snippet: Ohio has become a laboratory for a political strategy designed to discourage women from getting abortions and hamper clinic operations, without flagrantly violating Supreme Court precedent.
abstract: Ohio has become a laboratory for what anti-abortion leaders call the incremental strategy--passing a web of rules designed to push hazy boundaries of Supreme Court guidelines without flagrantly violating them; critics say many of the rules are designed to discourage women from getting abortions or to hamper clinic operations, even forcing some to close.
lead_paragraph: Ohio has become a laboratory for a political strategy designed to discourage women from getting abortions and hamper clinic operations, without flagrantly violating Supreme Court precedent.

headline.main: With New Abortion Restrictions, Ohio Walks a Narrow Legal Line
headline.print_headline: With New Abortion Restrictions, Ohio Walks a Narrow Legal Line
